title: Quiz 10: Comprehensive Final Review
description: A comprehensive review covering all modules: sociology, psychology, culture, interaction, and social change.

questions.question: Which concept best describes the feeling of disorientation when experiencing an unfamiliar culture?
questions.explanation: Culture shock is the anxiety/disorientation experienced when encountering a different culture.

questions.question: Match the theorist to their primary contribution:
questions.hint: Connect the names to their big ideas.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is the process by which a person learns the culture of their society, while ___BLANK___ is the process of learning the culture of a different group.
questions.explanation: Socialization is internalizing one's own culture; Acculturation is adapting to a new one.

questions.question: Which of the following are consequences of social stratification on health? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Differences in exposure to health hazards

questions.explanation: Stratification leads to inequality in access, risk, and outcomes. Outcomes are NOT uniform.
questions.hint: Does being rich or poor affect health?

questions.question: Order the hierarchy of social structures from micro to macro:
The 'Nature vs. Nurture' debate has been settled by acknowledging that both biology (nature) and environment (nurture) interact to influence development.
questions.explanation: True. Modern science accepts the interaction of both factors.
questions.hint: Is it just one or the other?

questions.question: Which type of leader encourages group participation and decision-making?
What is the sociological term for a status that is assigned at birth or involuntarily (e.g., race, sex)?
questions.explanation: Ascribed status is given; Achieved status is earned.

questions.question: Identify the factors that can cause Role Conflict: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Conflicting expectations from supervisors and subordinates

questions.explanation: Role conflict arises from having MULTIPLE, clashing roles.
questions.hint: When you have too many hats to wear.

questions.question: Social change always leads to positive outcomes for all members of society.
questions.explanation: False. Social change can have negative consequences (e.g., displacement, loss of tradition, new diseases).
questions.hint: Is change always good for everyone?
